question_text: What is hardware initialization and when does it occur during the boot process?
answer_options: After the operating system loads, to configure peripherals
During POST, where BIOS/UEFI prepares hardware components for operation
Only when new hardware is detected by the system
At shutdown, to save hardware configuration settings
correct_answer: During POST, where BIOS/UEFI prepares hardware components for operation
explanation: Hardware initialization is the process where the BIOS/UEFI checks and prepares hardware components (CPU, memory, storage devices, peripherals) for operation. It occurs immediately after POST and before the operating system begins loading, ensuring all hardware is ready for system operation.
